titleStmt.title: The divine penitential meditations and vovves of His late Sacred Majesty in his solitude at Holmby-House, faithfully turned into verse. By E.R. Gentleman.
titleStmt.author: Reynolds, Edward, 1599-1676.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649, attributed name.
Gauden, John, 1605-1662. Eikōn basilikē.

notesStmt.note: A verse translation, by Edward Reynolds, of selections from: Eikōn basilikē, the text of which is included. Authorship of the Eikon basilike was originally attributed to Charles I, but according to Madan (pp. 125-33) it was written by John Gauden who probably included some authentic writings of the king.
At head of title page: Numb. 1.
With a portrait of Charles I on the verso of the first leaf.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
